timeline.message: Setting up profile to execute BadJdkReferenceChecker

timeline.bodyText: we need a better name for this. What's a "bad JDK"?
timeline.author: elharo

timeline.bodyText: per google style do not use "Please" in UI messages
timeline.author: elharo
elharo
elharo

replies.bodyText: Added Javadoc. I'll prepare another document (wiki) to explain how to use this tool.
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText:
delete "bad"
perhaps "classes in 'java' package" --> classes in the core library
which do not work for --> which are not present in
timeline.author: elharo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -109,7 +109,7 @@ public static void main(String[] arguments)
     StringBuilder message = new StringBuilder();
     message.append(
         "The following artifacts contain bad references to classes in 'java' package,"

timeline.bodyText: dependency graph of each of the artifacts above
timeline.author: elharo
elharo

timeline.bodyText: I'm surprised this works since it's a resource in a jar, not a file. Could we skip both URIs and paths here and get a stream from the resource instead?
timeline.author: elharo

replies.bodyText:
This works because it reads the XML file from target directory. With maven-exec-plugin (used by java8-incompatible-reference-check.sh), the value (toString) of exclusionFile is Users/suztomo/cloud-opensource-java/dependencies/target/classes/java8-incompatible-reference-check-exclusion.xml, not from a JAR file.
LinkageChecker.create() takes Path for an exclusion file.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: I'll trust you that it works, but this still looks very brittle to me. Can we add a method to LinkageChecker that takes an InputStream to avoid this.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText:
I tried adding another factory method for LinkageChecker to take URL (not InputStream, because ExcludedErrors already takes URL) but the change is unexpectedly large 01b6dc4
I will just use Path for the exclusion xml as second parameter, without URL or InputStream.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: Now the exclusion file is passed as the second parameter. No need to deal with URL.
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText: This is what would contain the return type change?
timeline.author: elharo

timeline.message: LinkageChecker to take exclusion file URL
Exclusion file to be arguments specified in pom.xml
